lead_paragraph: JOURDAIN--Luis Manuel Senior, of State College, died Wednesday, April 13, 2016, at Mount Nittany Medical Center, State College, PA. Born March 14, 1937 in the Dominican Republic, he was a son of Luis Emilio and Clara Senior J. He married Alejandrina Pichardo Liranzo, on June 22, 1963. He is survived by his wife, five children, Luis Manuel, Jr., of State College, Alexandra Carolina Wentz Jourdain and her husband, Robert, of Pittsburgh, Marc and wife Erica, of Tampa, FL, Jessica, of Hackensack, NJ, Luchy M. Reeder and her husband, Mark, of Harmony, FL, six grandchildren, Luis Jourdain Wentz, Connor, Jordon and Calista Wentz, Marc Jose Jourdain II, Matthew Alejandro Jourdain and three siblings, Temistocles, Atocha and Ramonita Jourdain of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. Luis graduated as "Doctor in Medicine" from the Universidad de Autonoma de Santo Domingo, in October 1962. This institution is the oldest in the Western Hemisphere. In 1962 he immigrated to the United States with his wife, Alejandrina, to begin his career. Luis Manuel served in the US Army and was promoted to the rank of Major and later to Chief of Pathology at Fort Monmouth, New Jersey. Upon his Honorable Discharge he accepted a position at the Altoona and Tyrone Hospitals. He was an Associate Professor at Hahnemann University and also taught nursing students at the Altoona Hospital and was a member of its Board. He was an active member of Our Lady of Victory Catholic Church and the Knights of Columbus, a man of great faith who loved helping others. He also helped out at Penn State football games since the 1990's. Luis Manuel was an extraordinary gentleman with great character. His legacy will continue to live on through his family and those whose lives he touched. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  JOURDAIN, LUIS MANUEL SENIOR
